intro: Hosackia puberula, commonly known as the slender milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, pea-like flowers. The plant has compound leaves with numerous small leaflets and produces small, round pods that contain seeds. It typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Hosackia puberula plays a role in soil stabilization and provides forage for wildlife.
